column2: The largest city in Golarion.
A city-state in the magic-dead region of the Mana Wastes known for its vast knowledge of technology, especially the invention of firearms.
The capital of the free nation of Andoran.
The capital of Rahadoum. It is the birthplace of the Laws of Man.
The capital of Molthune. It is said even the poor of Canorate live in luxury.
The capital of the military nation Cheliax. Also known as the City of Thorns.
The capital of Sargava. The city is ruled by its many trading companies.
A vicious, permanent hurricane. Sailors tell legends of ghost ships and aquatic undead.
A logging village in Darkmoon Vale comprised almost entirely of lumbermen.
The site of the final battle between the wizard-king Tar-Baphon and the god Aroden. Today it is plagued by monsters and undead.
A clifftop city built in the ruins of an ancient fortress. It serves as a refuge for exiles and misfits.
The biggest city in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings also known as the Thanelands.
The capital of Qadira. It is a large trading hub.
The largest city in Varisia, of which it was once the capital. It now claims independent authority of the region.
The largest of the five Thuvian allied city states, the closest it has to a capital.
The capital of the Impossible Kingdom of Jalmeray. It is a meeting place for travelers and scholars from all over Golarion.
Oppara, the City of Empire, is the capital of Taldor. It is plagued with poverty and crime.
The capital of Nex. The city prides itself on its diversity.
The capital of Osirion, a desert nation.
The capital of Numeria. It is ruled by the Black Sovereign, a brutal dictator.
The unofficial capital of the Orc-ruled Hold of Belkzen.
